column2: Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan
column3: UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund
column4: San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan
column5: Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan

column2: "The Plan Year (which is a calendar year)." (2020.07.01 - SPD - Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan.pdf, p. 6, para 5)
column3: "Each plan year (June 1 – May 31)..." (2005.06.01 - SPD - Hotel Employees & Restaurant Employees Pension Trust.pdf, p. 32, Table)
column4: "“Plan Year” means the period from April 1 through March 31 of the following year." (2018.12.01 - SPD - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 23, para 4)
column5: "The Plan Year commences on June 1 and ends on May 31." (2016.09.01 - SPD - Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 33, para 2)

column2: "Trust Fund Office... Zenith American Solutions, Inc." (2020.07.01 - SPD - Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan.pdf, p. 22, para 2)
column3: "Board of Trustees has decided to change the Fund administration from Welfare & Pension Administration Service, Inc. (WPAS) to Northwest Administrators, Inc. (NWA)... effective October 1, 2018." (2018.09.01 - Notice - UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - Admin Change.pdf, p. 3, para 7)
column4: "Board of Trustees... has engaged Northwest Administrators, Inc., to perform the routine administration of the Trust." (2018.12.01 - SPD - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 92, para 7)
column5: "BeneSys Administrators... 3737 Camino Del Rio South, Suite 300 San Diego, CA 92108" (2016.09.01 - SPD - Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 6, para 2)

column2: "You automatically become covered on the first day Contributions are made or required to be made on your behalf... provided you have 300 Hours of Service during the Plan Year" (2020.07.01 - SPD - Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan.pdf, p. 6, para 5)
column3: "You automatically participate in this plan if your employer is required to contribute to it on your behalf according to a collective bargaining agreement..." (2005.06.01 - SPD - Hotel Employees & Restaurant Employees Pension Trust.pdf, p. 31, para 1)
column4: "You will become a Participant of the Plan when you have worked sufficient time... to have three (3) months of Employer Contributions made within a Plan Year" (2018.12.01 - SPD - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 3, para 5)
column5: "You become a Participant in the Plan on the earlier of: a. the first day of the month after you have had Employer Contributions made on your behalf for at least five calendar months in a Plan Year; or b. the June 1 or December 1 coincident with or immediately following the date you complete at least 1,000 Hours of Service in a period of twelve consecutive months..." (2016.09.01 - SPD - Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 7, para 5-7)

column2: "Five Year Vesting - If you have worked at least one hour in Covered Employment on or after January 1, 1997 your Pension Credits become 100% Vested... Ten Year Vesting - If you have not worked at least one hour in Covered Employment on or after January 1, 1997, your Pension Credits become 100% Vested at any age when you have ten full years of Past and Future Pension Credits." (2020.07.01 - SPD - Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan.pdf, p. 17, para 3-4)
column3: "In most cases, to become vested you must earn five years of service. If you work 1,000 or more hours per plan year... you will earn one year of service each year." (2005.06.01 - SPD - Hotel Employees & Restaurant Employees Pension Trust.pdf, p. 28, para 1)
column4: "(a) You have completed at least one (1) hour of service on or after April 1, 1998 and have completed at least five (5) years of Vesting Service without an intervening Permanent Break in Service..." (2018.12.01 - SPD - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 4, para 4)
column5: "To be vested... the earliest of the following has occurred: (1) you worked one or more hours in Covered Employment on or after June 1, 1999, and you have been credited with at least 5 years of Vested Pension Credit... (3) the later of age 65 and the fifth anniversary of your participation in the Plan after June 1, 1988..." (2016.09.01 - SPD - Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 8, para 3)

column2: "January 1, 1976 and after. One year of Future Service Credit is earned for 1,000 or more hours worked in Covered Employment in a calendar year. Fractions of a year will be counted if 300 or more, but less than 1,000 hours are worked." (2020.07.01 - SPD - Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan.pdf, p. 8, para 5)
column3: "1,000 or more [hours] = 1 year; 850 – 999 = 4/5 year; 700 – 849 = 3/5 year; 550 – 699 = 2/5 year; 400 – 549 = 1/5 year; Fewer than 400 = 0 year" (2005.06.01 - SPD - Hotel Employees & Restaurant Employees Pension Trust.pdf, p. 32, Table)
column4: "(i) Six (6) or more monthly Employer contributions made, or due to be made on your behalf in a Plan Year. If you are entitled to less than six (6) monthly Employer Contributions in a Plan Year, pro-rata partial credit toward a year of Vesting Service, up to a maximum (1) year of Vesting Service will be granted" (2018.12.01 - SPD - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 9, para 2)
column5: "Count one year of Future Service Credit for each Plan Year in which you work at least 1,000 Hours of Covered Employment... Count one-half (1/2) year of Future Service Credit for each Plan year in which you work at least 500 Hours of Service in Covered Employment..." (2016.09.01 - SPD - Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 15, para 3)

column2: "REGULAR RETIREMENT - AGE 62 - You will be eligible for a Regular Pension at age 62 with 5 years of Pension Credit, provided that you worked at least one covered hour on or after January 1, 1997..." (2020.07.01 - SPD - Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan.pdf, p. 6, para 6)
column3: "Your normal retirement date is the first day of the month that coincides with or immediately follows your 65th birthday. To be eligible for normal retirement at that time, you must be vested." (2005.06.01 - SPD - Hotel Employees & Restaurant Employees Pension Trust.pdf, p. 35, para 6)
column4: "You will become entitled to a Normal Pension Benefit if you are at least age 65, have retired and terminated employment, and have completed one (1) of the following: (a) You have completed at least one (1) hour of service on or after April 1, 1998 and have completed at least five (5) years of Vesting Service..." (2018.12.01 - SPD - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 4, para 3-4)
column5: "You may retire with a Normal Retirement Benefit upon reaching age 65 and the earliest of the following has occurred: (1) you worked one or more hours in Covered Employment on or after June 1, 1999, and you have been credited with at least 5 years of Vested Pension Credit..." (2016.09.01 - SPD - Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 14, para 6)

column2: "EARLY RETIREMENT - AGE 55-61 - You will be eligible for an Early Retirement Pension at age 55 with 5 years of Pension Credit, provided you worked at least one hour on or after January 1, 1997..." (2020.07.01 - SPD - Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan.pdf, p. 7, para 3)
column3: "You may retire as early as the first day of any month after your 55th birthday if you have: At least 10 years of credited service, including at least 5 years of credited future service." (2005.06.01 - SPD - Hotel Employees & Restaurant Employees Pension Trust.pdf, p. 36, para 4)
column4: "You may elect an Early Retirement Pension Benefit if you retire from the industry on and after age 62 and before age 65, provided you have completed at least ten (10) years of Vesting Service without a Permanent Break in Service." (2018.12.01 - SPD - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 4, para 5)
column5: "You are eligible for an Early Pension at your Early Retirement Date... on or after age fifty-five (55) if you have ten (10) years of Past and Future Service (at least one (1) of which must be Future Service Credit)... or, if an Employee has at least one (1) hour of Covered Employment on or after June 1, 1996, five (5) or more Vesting Years of Service." (2016.09.01 - SPD - Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 17, para 4)

column2: "You then reduce the Regular Benefit by: (A) 0.75% per month for each month that your Early Pension precedes age 62 if you retire on or after age 60, but prior to age 62; and (B) An additional 0.50% per month for each month that your Early Pension precedes age 60..." (2020.07.01 - SPD - Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan.pdf, p. 12, para 3)
column3: "There will be no early retirement factor changes for active participants, only for certain terminated participants... The new factors are intended to be 'actuarially equivalent,'... Age 55... New Factors 35%." (2013.04.26 - SMM - Hotel Employees & Restaurant Employees Pension Trust - Rehab Plan.pdf, p. 11, para 2-4 and Table)
column4: "The amount payable to you on Early Retirement will be equal to the Normal Pension... reduced by 6/10 of 1 percent for each month that you are younger than Normal Retirement Age..." (2018.12.01 - SPD - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 35, para 3)
column5: "[Y]our benefit will be reduced by one-half (½) of one percent (1%) for each month that your Early Retirement Date precedes your Normal Retirement Date." (2016.09.01 - SPD - Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 17, para 5)

column2: "Service Requirements: To be eligible for a Disability Pension, you must have earned (i) at least five (5) years of Pension Credit, and (ii) a total of at least 300 hours during the period which includes the calendar year of your disability and the year before the disability." (2020.07.01 - SPD - Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan.pdf, p. 12, para 7)
column3: "You have 10 years of service, including at least 1 year of credited future service, and You are not retired or eligible for normal retirement." (2005.06.01 - SPD - Hotel Employees & Restaurant Employees Pension Trust.pdf, p. 45, para 1) "Elimination of the disability benefit after age 55 and reduction of the disability benefit before age 55." (2013.04.26 - SMM - Hotel Employees & Restaurant Employees Pension Trust - Rehab Plan.pdf, p. 6, para 1)
column4: "(1) He has at least fifteen (15) years Vesting Service without an intervening Permanent Break in Service; (2) He has attained age 55 but has not yet attained age 65; and (3) He has filed an application for Disability Pension Benefits..." (2018.12.01 - SPD - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 34, para 8)
column5: "This Plan does not provide a Disability Benefit." (2016.09.01 - SPD - Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 13, para 6)

column2: "Amount of Benefit: The amount of Disability Pension will be equal to the amount of Regular Pension Benefit you have earned..." (2020.07.01 - SPD - Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan.pdf, p. 13, para 3)
column3: "disability benefits before age 55 will be reduced to the actuarial equivalent of the age 55 early retirement benefit." (2013.04.26 - SMM - Hotel Employees & Restaurant Employees Pension Trust - Rehab Plan.pdf, p. 9, para 7)
column4: "The monthly amount of the Disability Pension is determined in the same way as the monthly amount of the Normal Pension is determined." (2018.12.01 - SPD - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 35, para 3)

column2: "Future Service Credit (1976 and thereafter)... 2000 and over... $37.83 [Monthly Benefit]" (2020.07.01 - SPD - Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan.pdf, p. 9, Table) "First, you will receive a 10% increase in all benefits you earn on or after January 1, 2016. Second, you will receive a 10% increase in all of the benefits you earned after 1975..." (2017.02.17 - SMM - Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - Benefit Increase & Disability.pdf, p. 1, para 3-4)
column3: "For service on and after June 1, 2010, you will accrue $10 of monthly benefit starting at age 65 for every $1,000 of contributions." (2010.05.14 - SMM - Hotel Employees & Restaurant Employees Pension Trust - Plan Changes.pdf, p. 19, para 5) "The additional contributions due to the rehabilitation increases are intended to improve the Plan’s funding status. No future benefits will accrue on the additional contributions." (2013.04.26 - SMM - Hotel Employees & Restaurant Employees Pension Trust - Rehab Plan.pdf, p. 14, para 6)
column4: "For the Plan Years April 1, 1990 through March 31, 2018, the monthly benefit is based on $25.00 if your employer is not a level IV, V or VI Window Benefit Employer and contributed at the maximum Contribution rate. Otherwise... $18.80 per year..." (2018.12.01 - SPD - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 5, para 3)
column5: "May 1, 2019 and forward: Amount dependent on Plan’s PPA Market Value Funded Percentage... If the Funded Percentage is 100% or more: Amount will be 1.60% of all Employer contributions... If the Funded Percentage is less than 80%: Amount will be 0.50%..." (2016.09.01 - SPD - Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 14-15, Table)

column2: "A break in service happens if you work less than 300 hours in a year. If you have enough break-in-service years, you will lose all of the benefits you earned in prior years." (2022.01.28 - SMM - Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - COVID-19 Assistance for 2020.pdf, p. 1, para 4)
column3: "In general, you incur a break in service when you don’t work at least 400 hours of service in any plan year." (2005.06.01 - SPD - Hotel Employees & Restaurant Employees Pension Trust.pdf, p. 70, para 1)
column4: "On or after April 1, 1987, you shall incur a Temporary Break in Service at the end of a Plan Year in which you do not earn at least four (4) months of Vesting Service or 500 Hours of Work... Such Break in Service shall become a Permanent Break in Service unless the Employee is reinstated... within a period of time equal to the greater of his previously accumulated Vesting Service or five consecutive Plan Years." (2018.12.01 - SPD - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 51, para 3)
column5: "You will permanently lose your credits and accrued benefits if you incur a Cancellation of Pension Credit before becoming vested. You will incur a Cancellation of Pension Credit if the number of consecutive Breaks in Service you have exceeds the greatest of five (5) or your total previous years of Past and Future Service Credit." (2016.09.01 - SPD - Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 24, para 6)

column2: "Generally, your benefits will be paid as a 50% Joint and Survivor Annuity with Pop-Up... If you die and your spouse is living, he or she will receive a monthly benefit for his or her lifetime equal to 50% of the monthly benefit..." (2020.07.01 - SPD - Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan.pdf, p. 15, para 2)
column3: "The lifetime monthly survivor pension will be equal to the amount your spouse would have received if you had lived to your earliest retirement date, retired, and chosen a 50% Spouse Option payment method on the day before you died." (2005.06.01 - SPD - Hotel Employees & Restaurant Employees Pension Trust.pdf, p. 47, para 3)
column4: "if you have earned a vested benefit and you die before attaining age 62, your Spouse will be entitled to a pension in an amount equal to one-half (½) the amount that would have been payable to you if you had separated from Covered Employment on the date of your death..." (2018.12.01 - SPD - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 11, para 5)
column5: "If you were married upon death, your spouse may elect to receive the benefit provided to an unmarried Employee upon death or, if you were vested, your spouse may elect to receive 50% of the Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity..." (2016.09.01 - SPD - Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 20, para 5)

column2: "Generally, your benefits will be paid as a 50% Joint and Survivor Annuity with Pop-Up" (2020.07.01 - SPD - Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan.pdf, p. 15, para 1) "Life Annuity... monthly pension from the Plan for life, and upon your death, no benefits will be paid" (2020.07.01 - SPD - Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan.pdf, p. 16, para 1)
column3: "The 36-month guarantee feature (modified life annuity) included with the single life annuity will no longer be included as part of the normal benefit option... Now, the normal benefit option will be a life annuity only." (2013.04.26 - SMM - Hotel Employees & Restaurant Employees Pension Trust - Rehab Plan.pdf, p. 9, para 3)
column4: "If you are married on the date of Normal or Early Retirement, you will receive a 50 percent Qualified Joint and Survivor Benefit... unless you and your Spouse elect in writing not to receive such benefit." (2018.12.01 - SPD - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 10, para 6) "The Joint Pension is Actuarially Equivalent to the single life pension, which is the normal form of benefit under this Plan for non-married Participants." (2018.12.01 - SPD - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 57, para 2)
column5: "If you are married and do not choose another option, your benefit will be paid as a fifty percent (50%) Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity. If you are not married, your benefit will be paid as a Life Annuity with a three (3) year guarantee." (2016.09.01 - SPD - Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 22, para 5)

column2: "Your 2020 hours will be automatically increased to the same number of hours you worked in 2019." (2022.01.28 - SMM - Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - COVID-19 Assistance for 2020.pdf, p. 1, para 2)
column4: "SPECIAL VESTING RULES DUE TO COVID 19 PANDEMIC... you shall receive a Year of Vesting Service for the Plan Year commencing April 1, 2020 and ending on March 31, 2021 regardless of whether the requisite Employer Contributions normally required were made..." (2022.04.01 - SMM - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders & Service Employees Pension Fund - Benefit Improvements.pdf, p. 5, para 3)
column5: "Effective immediately, joint IRS and DOL emergency regulation requires the Plan to disregard the period from March 1, 2020 until sixty (60) days after the announced end of the National Emergency... for all Plan Participants... in determining the following periods... 1. Plan’s Claims Filing Procedure... 2. Plan’s Appeals Procedure." (2020.06.01 - SMM - Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan - COVID & RMD.pdf, p. 1, para 3-5)

column2: "In any event, you must commence your pension benefit by your required beginning date, which is April 1st following the year you either (i) actually retire... or (ii) attain your required beginning age. ... if you reach age 70½ on or after January 1, 2020, your required beginning age is 72." (2020.07.01 - SPD - Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan.pdf, p. 7, para 2)
column3: "You must start receiving your monthly pension the April 1st following the year you reach age 70-1/2..." (2005.06.01 - SPD - Hotel Employees & Restaurant Employees Pension Trust.pdf, p. 37, para 2)
column4: "Effective for a participant who reaches age 70 ½ on or after January 1, 2020... distributions shall be made or commence no later than April 1 of the calendar year following the later of the calendar year in which the Participant attains age 72 or the calendar year in which the Participant retires." (2022.04.01 - SMM - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders & Service Employees Pension Fund - Benefit Improvements.pdf, p. 2, para 1)
column5: "Effective January 1, 2020... you must elect to commence benefits on April 1st of the calendar year following the calendar year in which you turn age 72..." (2016.09.01 - SPD - Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 20, para 2)

column3: "As communicated in the Notice of Critical Status that was sent to all Participants in a letter dated September 28, 2012, the actuary for the Hotel Employees Restaurant Employees Pension Plan (the “Plan”) declared the Plan to be in Critical Status... the Board of Trustees is required to adopt a Rehabilitation Plan" (2013.04.26 - SMM - Hotel Employees & Restaurant Employees Pension Trust - Rehab Plan.pdf, p. 5, para 3)
column5: "May 1, 2019 and forward... If the Funded Percentage is less than 80%: Amount will be 0.50% of all Employer contributions made on your behalf during the Plan Year." (2016.09.01 - SPD - Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan.pdf, p. 15, Table)

column4: "ELIGIBILITY FOR THE 4-YEAR $50 WINDOW VII BENEFIT... retire... between April 1, 2019 and April 1, 2023." (2022.04.01 - SMM - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders & Service Employees Pension Fund - Benefit Improvements.pdf, p. 1, para 7) "ELIGIBILITY FOR THE 6-YEAR $50 WINDOW VII BENEFIT... retire... between April 1, 2019, and April 1, 2025..." (2022.04.01 - SMM - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders & Service Employees Pension Fund - Benefit Improvements.pdf, p. 2, para 7) "5-Year $45 Special Window VI Benefit... retire between October 1, 2021, and October 1, 2026." (2022.04.01 - SMM - San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders & Service Employees Pension Fund - Benefit Improvements.pdf, p. 4, para 2-4)
